incident_updates.body: Issue causing a service interruption with the Letter of Authorization template documents in the Twilio Console Porting page has been resolved and is operating normally at this time.

Our engineers have identified the issue causing a service interruption with the Letter of Authorization template documents in the Twilio Console Porting page and are working to deploy a fix. In the mean time, you can access the LOA template from our support website here: https://support.twilio.com/hc/en-us/article_attachments/5150940275355.

incidents.name: Error 63013 With Verify WhatsApp

incident_updates.body: We have implemented a fix on the WhatsApp channel for the Verify API, and we no longer are experiencing 63013 errors when sending Verify WhatsApp messages. This incident has been resolved.

The issue causing an increase in error 63013 when using the Verify API with the WhatsApp channel has been identified. Our team is actively working on a fix that is targeted for deployment tomorrow morning Mountain Daylight Time (MDT). We expect to provide another update in 16 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

The issue causing an increase in error 63013 when using the Verify API with the WhatsApp channel has been identified. Our team is actively working on a fix that is targeted for deployment tomorrow morning Mountain Daylight Time (MDT). We expect to provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

incidents.name: Voice affected by errors

incident_updates.body: Twilio Voice was degraded for 1 minute between 07:16 and 07:17 Pacific Time on 10/23/2023. During this period of time customers may have experienced 5xx status code errors. The issue has now been resolved.

incidents.name: SMS Delivery Delays to Jersey Telecom Network in Jersey

incident_updates.body: After investigation with our carrier partner, we found that although the carrier partner did experience SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Jersey Telecom Network in Jersey, this had no impact on Twilio's customers. We have identified ways to further avoid any impact to customers. This incident has been resolved.

We are continuing to experience SMS delivery delays when sending messages to Jersey Telecom Network in Jersey. Our engineers are working with our carrier partner to resolve the issue. We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

Beginning at 00:00 am PT time, we were notified of a potential outage affecting multiple KORE systems, specifically impacting user experiences on the KORE Console, and Billing. This disruption means users may experience difficulties logging into the KORE Console (https://console.korewireless.com/) and may be restricted from linking or verifying accounts in the console. Additionally, viewing invoices will be restricted for those with linked and verified accounts.
Importantly, this does not affect customer SIM management activities, which remain fully operational within the Twilio Console. However, customers will not see amounts billed for data usage when viewing Usage in Console or via the UsageRecords APIs for both Programmable Wireless and Super SIM until the incident is mitigated. There are no delays in reporting the amount of bytes used by these SIMs. The amounts billed will be updated once the incident is resolved and delayed records are processed. We will provide more information in 1 hour or as soon as more information is available.
